profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Savannah, Ga., in July 1790; resided at Clarkesville; elected as a Jacksonian to the Twenty-fourth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of James M. Wayne; reelected as a Democrat to the Twenty-fifth Congress and served (October 5, 1835-March 3, 1839); died in Clarkesville, Habersham County, Ga.; death date unknown.

researchRecord.name: Letters, William Turner, 1839, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Letters from Jabez Jackson regarding an appointment to the U.S. Military Academy.

recordLocation.name: Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collection Library

researchRecord.name: In the letters of Jabez Jackson, 1838-1839, 1 folder.
researchRecord.description: The collection consists of letters written by Jabez Jackson while he was in Congress, 1838-1839.

researchRecord.name: In File II Names.
researchRecord.description: File is primarily incoming correspondence to the Governor of Georgia. Finding aid in repository.

recordLocation.name: Georgia Department of Archives and History
